intro: Tetracera amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically yellow or greenish in color. Tetracera amazonica plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing food and shelter for various insects and animals.
